column4: hi, i have a problem using totem + gstreamer (bad + ugly) plugins to play .wmv or .ram files
when i open the file with totem it says i have to install the gstreamer plugin and shows me a synaptic-styled window, but it is already selected as "installed"
i have "reinstalled", completely removed, new-installed the gstremer plugin... without any success
can somebody please help me?
did you install w32codecs also?
yes, mplayer plays .rams but not .wmvs
should i use strece in order to examine the files opened by totem? maybe it tries to open the wrong path or something
this is the only option left... i simply have no idea why it doesn't work
mplayer makes no use of gstreamer plugins afaik. for totem you need them and for w32codecs you need the pitfdll plugin also
*strace*, sry
i can't find pidfdll in synaptic, do i have to install it manually?
gstreamer0.10-pitfdll
thanks, installed... i'm trying, one sec
it doesn't work: totem: search for suitable codec?
you have totem-gstreamer installed, not totem-xine?
one sec, checking
do you have that problem on a particular videofile or on all WMVs ?
i have totem-gstreamer installed, not totem-xine
on all wmvs (and rams on totem)
the ram files are playable with mplayer and they are 100% not drm'ed or something
strange, but i have no idea, sry
ok thanks anyway
